trans-unit.source: Declaratively instructs the .NET Framework to perform long-integer validation on a configuration property.
This class cannot be inherited.
You use the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute> attribute to decorate a configuration property.
This is to instruct the .NET Framework to validate the property using a <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidator> object and pass to it the value of the decorating parameters.
You can apply the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute> attribute to property types only.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute"></xref> class.
You use this constructor in the attributed model to ensure that the value assigned to the related property is a long integer.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include or exclude the integers in the range defined by the <xref href="System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue"></xref> and <xref href="System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue"></xref> property values.
The range is inclusive of the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A> property values.
When the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.ExcludeRange%2A> property value is `false`, the allowed values are outside the range.
`true` if the value must be excluded; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the maximum value allowed for the property.
The <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A> property value is included in the allowed range.
A long integer that indicates the allowed maximum value.
The selected value is less than <xref href="System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue"></xref>.
Gets or sets the minimum value allowed for the property.
The <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue%2A> property value is included in the allowed range.
An integer that indicates the allowed minimum value.
The selected value is greater than <xref href="System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue"></xref>.
Gets an instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.LongValidator"></xref> class.

You use the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.ValidatorInstance%2A> property value to perform string validation by calling its <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidator.Validate%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorBase"></xref> validator instance.
